title.narrative: Empowerment and raising voice of ethnic

description.narrative:
This is the continuation of the project #Empowerment and raising voice of ethnic minority people in Dak Glong district, Dak Nong province# from October 2013 to October 2015
The project #Empowerment and raising voice of ethnic minority people in Dak Glong district, Dak Nong province# aims to empower the ethnic minority people living in seven communes in Dak Glong to claim their social, culture and economic rights. The project fosters ethnic minorities# confidence to take action and identify solutions to their own problems and to become more active participants in community development activities. This project is among other projects of Oxfam aiming to empowerment and raising voice of ethnic minorities.
The project first started by Oxfam Hong Kong in October 2013 and was transferred to Oxfam Novib, the Executing Affiliate, after the phase out of OHK on 31 Dec 2014. The project is scheduled to complete by 31 March 2016.
Oxfam helps to coordinate the project partners, provides technical and strategic advice when needed and monitoring. Withthe partners, Oxfam facilitates organization of ethnic minorities groups, co-organize public and advocacy events with active engagement of ethnic minorities. Partners ensure capacity building for ethnic minorities, accompany the development of ethnic minority groups and facilitate learning process of the project. Using farmer groups and livelihoods as an entry point, opportunities are createdfor local women and men to work together, learn from each other, buildself-confidence, network with each other and jointly organizegroup activities such as exchange information on farming techniques, sharing their success and challenges in social and economic lives, and discuss on solutions to address challenges such as coping with price drops of agriculture products or how to secure land title, etc...
Art and cultural events are used to promote pride and self-esteem and to enable ethnic minority groups to practice their negotiation skills and exercise their influence on communities, the public and local authorities on values and prides of ethnic minorities and eventually their rights. The project also organizes dialogues between ethnic minorities, research institutes, civil society organizations and local and nationalauthorities on ethnic minority issues and policies that affect them, and carry out study tours to other provinces to look at collective action models. Finally, the project also raises public awareness and recognition of therights and capacities of ethnic minorities
An additional 9 months project proposal is proposed from 1 April to 31 Dec 2016 for thepurpose of consolidation, documentation and evaluation The focus of this final year will include the followings: # Documentation ofproject#s resultsand lessons learnt, and final project evaluation; # Consolidation the project#s results by reinforcing leadership and organizational skills of the Farmer Representatives through coaching and learning by doing # Handing over to local authorities and keyfarmers all the fundamental values of the project for sustainment and development

participating-org.narrative: CECEM Training & Consulting JSC CECEM T&C

CECEM CECEM (Center for Community Empowerment) is a service organization in Vietnam, adding values to development programmes through providing professional training, consultancies and implementing projects in the fields of adult learning, participatoryproject management, organisation development , and small and medium enterprises development. CECEM partners with INGOs, Vietnamese NGOs, bilateral and multilateral projects, development projects funded by the embassies, public organisations, and small andmedium enterprises in the rural area. CECEM shares common value and vision with Oxfam Novib in term of community empowerment, where the community capacity are built and local potentialities are explored to help them to realize their own problem, causes and how to overcome their challenge by implementing their own action. Oxfam Novib and CECEM see big potentiality to collaborate with each other to promote WEMAN in development projects in Viet Nam.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
